title: American_Top_40_1976_February_14th
description:
"From Pango Pango in Samoa, to Punxsutawney in Pennsylvania, you're hearing the forty biggest hits in the United States this week. At number twelve moving up seven, the Eagles and 'Take It To The Limit.'"


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Aerosmith has their very first top 40 hit with the song "Dream On," but it's a song was on the chart two-and-a-half years earlier, getting only as high as number 59. 

Casey plays a piece of the first recording in history ever to sell a million copies.

A listener asks, "What year during the rock era had the most female singers hitting number one?"

Another listener asks, "What husbands and wives have had solo hits on the top 40 separately from one another while they were married?"

On this Valentine's Day of 1976, we hear songs titled "Sweet Love," "Love Machine," "You Sexy Thing," and "Love To Love You Baby."

We also hear songs titled "Breaking Up Is Hard To Do," "All By Myself," "Love Hurts," and the number one song "50 Ways To Leave Your Lover."

40:    Tangerine - Salsoul Orchestra
39:    Sweet Love - The Commodores
38:    Money Honey - The Bay City Roller
